title: Senior Engineering Manager,  Apple Data Platform
summary: Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, innovative ideas have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish! As we continue to grow and evolve, we are seeking a dynamic Senior Manager to lead our team of Data and Machine Learning (ML) Solution Architects. As the Senior Manager, you will play a crucial role in defining and executing our vision for the adoption of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and ML technologies across Apple.
description:
In this role, you will define the vision and strategy, and lead the execution of innovative solutions for internal customers that leverage our platform capabilities, across Apple.

TEAM LEADERSHIP:
- Lead and mentor a team of Data and ML Solution Architects, providing guidance, support, and professional development opportunities.
- Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning within the team.
TECHNICAL LEADERSHIP:
- Provide technical leadership and expertise in the design and implementation of AI/ML solutions.
- Stay abreast of the latest advancements in AI/ML, driving innovation and continuous improvement.
CUSTOMER ENGAGEMENT:
- Work closely with internal stakeholders and business units to understand their needs and requirements related to AI/ML.
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop tailored AI/ML solutions that address specific business challenges and opportunities.
ADOPTION AND CHANGE MANAGEMENT:
- Drive the adoption of AI/ML technologies and methodologies across the organization, ensuring alignment with business goals and objectives.
- Develop and implement strategies for change management, training, and communication to facilitate the successful adoption of AI/ML initiatives.
PERFORMANCE MANAGEMENT:
- Define key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure the effectiveness and impact of AI/ML initiatives.
- Monitor and analyze performance data, providing insights and recommendations for continuous improvement.
preferred_qualifications:
Excellent understanding of data technologies, tools and frameworks.
Strong understanding of data architecture, data engineering, and data science concepts.
Proven ability to develop and execute strategic plans, driving business results through technology innovation.
Solid project management skills: Prioritization, communicating across team/org boundaries
Experience recruiting for your team: Predicting staffing needs, designing interview loops, evaluating candidates and closing them.
pay_benefits:
At Apple, base pay is one part of our total compensation package and is determined within a range. This provides the opportunity to progress as you grow and develop within a role. The base pay range for this role is between $208,300 and $360,200, and your base pay will depend on your skills, qualifications, experience, and location.

Apple employees also have the opportunity to become an Apple shareholder through participation in Apple’s discretionary employee stock programs. Apple employees are eligible for discretionary restricted stock unit awards, and can purchase Apple stock at a discount if voluntarily participating in Apple’s Employee Stock Purchase Plan. You’ll also receive benefits including: Comprehensive medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, a range of discounted products and free services, and for formal education related to advancing your career at Apple, reimbursement for certain educational expenses — including tuition. Additionally, this role might be eligible for discretionary bonuses or commission payments as well as relocation. Learn more about Apple Benefits.

Note: Apple benefit, compensation and employee stock programs are subject to eligibility requirements and other terms of the applicable plan or program.
